alert.note: Alert for Eastern Lincoln County; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Southwest Chaves County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 31 at 4:04PM MST until February 03 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations from 4 to 10 inches, except up to 15 inches above 7500 feet, and only a few inches below canyons opening into the middle Rio Grande Valley from the east. Strong east winds below canyons opening into the central valley Wednesday night and and early Thursday morning will commonly gust up to 40 mph, except up to up 50 mph below Tijeras Canyon in Albuquerque. The wind will create areas of blowing snow with reduced visibility. * WHERE...Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque Metro Area, South Central Highlands, South Central Mountains, Eastern Lincoln County, and Southwest Chaves County. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Bitterly cold low temperatures mostly in the single digits above zero are expected Wednesday night. The wind will make the temperature feel like the single digits and teens below zero.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Lincoln County; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; South Central Highlands; South Central Mountains; Southwest Chaves County
